T_OBLIGATION.TITLE: CLRTAP (AE-1)
T_OBLIGATION.FORMAT_NAME: see ROD entry for reporting activity under CLRTAP
T_OBLIGATION.REPORTING_FORMAT: Reporting for this priority data flow is now under the obligation: Annual air emission data reporting (EMEP) for the UNECE Convention on Long Range Transport of Air Pollutants (CLRTAP).
T_OBLIGATION.PARAMETERS: CO (carbon monoxide)(mass/time) NH3 (ammonia)(mass/time) NMVOCs (non-methane volatile organic compounds)(mass/time) NOx (nitrogen oxides)(mass/time) SO2 (sulphur dioxide)(mass/time)

T_OBLIGATION.TITLE: PARCOM RECOMMENDATION 96/3 Concerning Best Available Techniques for the Manufacture of Suspension PVC from Vinyl Chloride Monomer
T_OBLIGATION.REPORTING_FORMAT: Implementation report to be submitted following commisioning of new plant and every 4 years for existing plants.

T_ROLE.ROLE_NAME: PCP and NRCs for Spatial Analysis and Land Cover in Malta

T_SOURCE.TITLE: Convention for the protection of the marine environment of the north-east Atlantic
T_SOURCE.LEGAL_NAME: Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the North-East Atlantic (OSPAR Convention 1992)
T_SOURCE.SECRETARIAT: OSPAR Secretariat, New Court , 48 Carey Street, London WC2A 2JQ / UK, Tel: +44 (0) 20 7430 5200, Fax: +44 (0) 20 7430 5225, e-mail: secretariat@ospar.org
T_SOURCE.ABSTRACT: The Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the North-East Atlantic ("OSPAR Convention").
T_SOURCE.COMMENT: The Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the North-East Atlantic ("OSPAR Convention") was opened for signature at the Ministerial Meeting of the Oslo and Paris Commissions in Paris on 22 September 1992. The Convention has been signed and ratified by all of the Contracting Parties to the Oslo or Paris Conventions (Belgium, Denmark, the Commission of the European Communities, Finland, France, Germany, Iceland, Ireland, the Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Sweden and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland) and by Luxembourg and Switzerland. The OSPAR Convention entered into force on 25 March 1998. It replaces the Oslo and Paris Conventions, but Decisions, Recommendations and all other agreements adopted under those Conventions will continue to be applicable, unaltered in their legal nature, unless they are terminated by new measures adopted under the 1992 OSPAR Convention. As its predecessors, the OSPAR Commission has the status of an international organisation in the terms of British legislation, recognised by a Headquarters Agreement with the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

T_SOURCE.TITLE: EEA Annual Management Plan
T_SOURCE.ABSTRACT: The Agency's work programme 2005 as well as the Strategy 2004-2008 is presented on this webpage. In 2006 work on the EEA/Eionet information system will be focused on improving the quality assurance of data flows with emphasis on the five thematic areas where EEA will act as a European data centre, including data for the core set of indicators plus the data flows envisaged under GEO, GEOSS, Inspire and GMES. Quality assurance and control procedures will be developed and agreed upon within Eionet and supported by the relevant European Topic Centres where appropriate. Analytical tools and services will continue to be enhanced to enable EEA clients to access and use information more readily. This general objective will run from 2006 - 08.
T_SOURCE.COMMENT: Former name was Annual Work Programme
